Label: Narrative
Text: The MOVING reference member state of this VC (Value Chain) is BULGARIA. The reference MOVING Card ID of this VC is VC 18 BG.   The reference mountain chain of this VC is Rhodope Mountains. The reference mountain landscape of this VC is Smolyan Municipality in Smolyan Province (BG424).   The size of the area (km2) is 859.6. The minimum altimetry of the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is unspecified. The maximum altimetry of the LAU is unspecified. The total population (in thousand) is 36.475. The population density (Inhabitants/km2) in the LAU is 42.43. The population change rate of the LAU in the last 10 years (%) is unspecified. The overall regional population density (Inhabitants/km2) is 63.70. The regional population change rate in the last 10 years (%) has been -0.06%.   The average per capita income (EUR/year) [Province] is 5400. The total Gross Value Added (GVA) (EUR million/year) [Province] is 500. The primary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 8.40%. The secondary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 38.80%. The tertiary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 52.80%. The per capita income (EUR/year) [Region] is 5600. The total Gross Value Added (GVA) (EUR million/year) [Region] is 6888. The primary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 5.90%. The secondary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 35.20%. The tertiary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 59.00%.   The total number of bed places (BPs) in tourist accommodations/year in the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is 10138. The regional (Region) share of total BPs/year is 37.40%. The number of agricultural holdings in the LAU is 20890. The nearest settlement with population over 100000 (km) is unspecified. In this region protected areas are present.   The primary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 20.50%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 38.00%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 41.40%. The primary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 24.20%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 30.70%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 45.10%.   Forest covers 37% of the territory of Bulgaria, of which 38% is timber producing and 62% is protective - notably for biodiversity. Forests are mainly owned by state enterprises. The South-Central State Enterprise - Smolyan - was registered in 2011 and manages 717,192 ha of state-owned forest (83% of total) in four districts. The forset stand is predominantly coniferous (55% pine and spruce) with altitude from 100 - 2,198 metres and 60% designated as Natura 2000. The Bulgarian forest sector has developed rapidly in recent years with growing timber production and stock, increased forest certification, introduction of more efficient and transparent trade mechanisms (electronic public timber tenders) and reforms addressing illegal logging and improving timber traceability. Around 20% of forest land is FSC-certified and likely to increase more due to the strong export orientation of the timber processing and manufacturing sector.   N/A. Overall the type of challenge faced by this VC is Current. This VC is classified as Traditional.   The type of innovation of this VC (Value Chain) is unspecified. The innovation is related to the whole VC. The land use systems involved are N/A. The local assets include Natural.
